author: Special Correspondent
text:
Yanam MLA Malladi Krishna Rao on Friday appeared as a prosecution witness before the Chief Judicial Magistrate in connection with a case that arose out of his complaint alleging that an outfit was creating division among the people of Union Territory.

In 2008, he lodged a complaint with the then Lieutenant Governor Govind Singh Gurjar against the outfit Murasoli Maran Peravai, which campaigned against the inclusion of MLAs from Yanam and Mahe in the cabinet ignoring the Puducherry region MLAs.

Complaint was registered by the Grand Bazaar police station and office bearers of outfit were charged. Mr. Malladi appeared before the court for recording his witness. The case was adjourned to March 1 for further proceeding.

Meanwhile, lawyers boycotted the proceedings at the combined court complex by observing the day as a “black day” to condemn the police attack in Madras High Court in 2009.
title: Yanam MLA appears as prosecution witness
